result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey K. Golomski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey K Golomski in court with attorney Sheila J Kessler. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF137, 13CF444, 12CF209

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Court will proceed with a PSI. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
12CF209 Count 1 - GUILTY
13CF444 Count 1 - GUILTY
13CF444 Count 3 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Defendant agrees to prior convictions as stated. 
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 12CF209 Count 1, 13CF444 Counts 1 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read in are 12CF209 Count 2, 13CF444 Count 2, 14CF137 in its entirety.
Court orders PSI.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey K. Golomski in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Veronica Fay Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.  Are likely to waive the prelim. 

BY THE COURT: 
Bond and conditions of bond are continued. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel Atty Kessler

Deposit $500 cash by the end of the day on Friday 3/28/2014 with the Clerk of Courts office, by 4:30 p.m. 
Comply with conditions ordered in 13CF444 and 12CF209.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Atty Knaapen recommends a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant indicates he can post the bond on Friday. Was employed at Mariani.  Was supposed to be starting at Heartland Farms today. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   April 7, 2014  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
